description: a(n) is multiplicative with a(2) = 1; a(4) = 2; a(2^i) = 2^(i-2)+2 if i>2; a(p^i) = 1+(p-1)*p^(i-1)/2 if prime p>2 and i>0.
references: Felix Weinstein, The Fibonacci Partitions, preprint, 1995.
links: F. V. Weinstein, Notes on Fibonacci partitions, arXiv:math/0307150 [math.NT]
mathematica: a[ n_] := If[ n < 2, Boole[ n == 1],Times @@ Apply[ Function[ {p, e}, If[p == 2, If[e < 3, e, 2^(e - 2) + 2], 1 + p^(e - 1) (p - 1)/2]], FactorInteger @ n, 1]]; (* _Michael Somos_, May 26 2014 *)
author: Felix Weinstein, Dec 11 1999 (wain(AT)ana.unibe.ch)
extensions: Changed name from phi(n) (which caused much confusion with the Euler phi-function) to a(n). - _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 26 2014
